Investigation Title: Biological Experiment-01 (BioExpt-01) mission
Investigation Description: Studying how life responds to conditions beyond low-Earth orbit.

Investigation Title: Deep Space Radiation Genomics (DSRG)
Investigation Description: Pioneering scientific discovery by correlating which genes provide yeast cells, Saccharomyces cerevisiae, with a higher probability of survival and the types and doses of radiation experienced beyond Earth's protective magnetosphere.

Investigation Title: Fuel to Mars
Investigation Description: Identifying genes and gene pathways in algae, Chlamydomonas reinhardtii, that convey the best survival advantage during exposure to the combined impacts of space radiation and microgravity to become the parent strains in future studies to optimize generation of hydrogen and other fuels in space.

Investigation Title: Investigating the Roles of Melanin and DNA Repair on Adaptation and Survivability of Fungi in Deep Space
Investigation Description: Determining the physiology and molecular pathways responsive to spaceflight using fungi, such as Aspergillus niger, a group of microorganisms commonly found in spacecrafts.

Investigation Title: Life Beyond Earth: Effect of Space Flight on Seeds with Improved Nutritional Value
Investigation Description: Understanding the impact of space flight beyond the Van Allen radiation belt on amino acids which are the building blocks of proteins in Arabidopsis thaliana seeds.

Investigation Title: ACES (Atomic Clock Ensemble in Space)
Investigation Description: is in partnership with the European Space Agency (ESA) mission that aims to help answer fundamental physics questions. By comparing a highly precise atomic clock aboard the International Space Station with numerous ground atomic clocks around the world (including ones coordinated by NASA).

Investigation Title: Advanced Combustion Microgravity Experiment (ACME) mission
Investigation Description: Was a set of five independent studies of gaseous flames conducted in the Combustion Integrated Rack (CIR)

Investigation Title: Burning Rate Emulator (BRE)
Investigation Description: Studies fire prevention, especially in spacecraft, by simulating the flammability of solid and liquid materials by burning gaseous fuels under key conditions corresponding to the solid and liquid materials.

Investigation Title: Coflow Laminar Diffusion Flame (CLD Flame)
Investigation Description: Investigates combustion at the extremes of the fuel dilution spectrum -- namely pure-fuel flames that produce soot, and highly diluted flames that are close to extinction.

Investigation Title: Electric-Field Effects on Laminar Diffusion Flames (E-FIELD Flames)
Investigation Description: Investigates how the ions can be used to control non-premixed flames in order to gain an improved understanding of flame production.

Investigation Title: Flame Design
Investigation Description: Improving our understanding of soot inception and control in order to enable the optimization of oxygen enriched combustion and the "design" of non-premixed flames that are both robust and soot free.

Investigation Title: Structure and Response of Spherical Flames (s-Flame)
Investigation Description: Advancing our ability to predict the structure and dynamics, including extinction, of both soot-free and sooty flames.

Investigation Title: Advanced Plant Experiment-07 (APEX-07)
Investigation Description: Examining how changes in gravity and other environmental factors associated with spaceflight affect plants at the level of gene expression

Investigation Title: Advanced Plant EXperiment-08 (APEX-08)
Investigation Description: Examining the role of polyamines in stress response mitigation to microgravity in Arabidopsis thaliana.

Investigation Title: Advanced Plant EXperiment-08 (APEX-09)
Investigation Description: C4 Photosynthesis in Space (C4 Space) (Advanced Plant Experiment-09 or APEX-09) examines the carbon dioxide capture mechanisms of two types of grasses, *Brachypodium distachyon* and *Setaria viridis.*

Investigation Title: Advanced Plant EXperiment-10 (APEX-10)
Investigation Description: This investigation tests whether the beneficial microbe *Trichoderma harzianum* confers increased stress resilience and improved growth to seedlings of tomato plants (*Lycopersicum esculentum*) when the two are grown together in microgravity.

Investigation Title: APEX-12 (Advanced Plant EXperiment-12)
Investigation Description: This investigation will test the hypothesis that induction of telomerase, a protein complex, activity in space protects plant DNA molecules from damage elicited by cellular stress evoked by the combined spaceflight stressors experienced by seedlings grown aboard the space station.

Investigation Title: Advanced Plant Habitat
Investigation Description: The largest, fully automated plant growth research facility that is used to conduct plant bioscience research on the International Space Station (ISS).

Investigation Title: An Integrated Omics Guided Approach to Lignification and Gravitational Responses: The Final Frontier (Plant Habitat-01)
Investigation Description: Comprehensively compared differences in genetics, metabolism, photosynthesis and gravity sensing between plants grown in space and on Earth.

Investigation Title: Assessment of Nutritional Value and growth Parameters of Space-grown Plants (Plant Habitat-02)
Investigation Description: Measured the metabolic and physiological responses of radishes grown in the Advanced Plant Habitat facility and identifies the effects of the space environment and culture conditions on metabolite accumulation, flavor, enzyme activity, mineral uptake and generation time.

Investigation Title: Epigenetic Adaptation to the Spaceflight Environment -- Accumulated Genomic Change Induced by Generations in Space (Plant Habitat-03)
Investigation Description: Assesses whether epigenetic adaptations in one generation of plants grown in space can transfer to the next generation.

Investigation Title: Effect of Spaceflight and Simulated Microgravity on Plant Defense Responses (Plant Habitat-06)
Investigation Description: Investigates the physiological and genetic responses to defense activation and immune system function in tomatoes during spaceflight.

Investigation Title: Alteration of Bacillus Subtilis DNA Architecture in Space: global effects on DNA supercoiling, methylation, and the transcriptome (BRIC-26)
Investigation Description: Understanding how the spaceflight environment can generate cellular outcomes that can in turn affect the greater health of the exploration ecosystem.

Investigation Title: ARTEMOSS (Antarctic Isolate 1 (ANT1) Radiation Tolerance Experiment with Moss in Orbit on the Space Station)
Investigation Description: The moss samples have already been exposed to solar radiation at the NASA Space Radiation Lab and a similar investigation will take place on the International Space Station testing how the moss recovers in different gravity environments.

Investigation Title: Bacterial Adhesion and Corrosion (BAC)
Investigation Description: explores the formation under microgravity conditions of multi-species biofilms, which may behave differently from single-species biofilms.

Investigation Title: Biological Research In Canisters-24 (BRIC-24)
Investigation Description: Testing the role of membrane contacts in plant gravity perception

Investigation Title: Biological Research in Canisters-25 (BRIC-25)
Investigation Description: Studies the effect of low Earth orbit on the physiology, cell-to-cell communication, and virulence of the bacterial pathogen *Staphylococcus aureus*.

Investigation Title: BioScience-4
Investigation Description: Studying the multiplication of nervous system stem cells in microgravity.

Investigation Title: BRazing of Aluminum alloys IN Space (SUBSA-BRAINS)
Investigation Description: Examines differences in capillary flow, interface reactions, and bubble formation during solidification of brazing alloys in microgravity.

Investigation Title: Cell Science-04 (CS-04)
Investigation Description: Using Water Bears to Identify Biological Countermeasures to Stress during Multigenerational Spaceflight

Investigation Title: Characterization of Biofilm Formation, Growth, and Gene Expression on Different Materials and Environmental Conditions in Microgravity (Space Biofilms)
Investigation Description: Characterizes the mass, thickness, structure, and associated gene expression of biofilms (molds) that form in space by analyzing a fungal species grown on different materials.

Investigation Title: Dendrite Fragmentation and Morphology During Melting and Solidification (DFM)
Investigation Description: Examining potential ability to produce metals with higher strength, both in space and on Earth.

Investigation Title: Device for the Study of Critical Liquids and Crystallization (DECLIC)
Investigation Description: A multi-user facility designed to support experiments in the fields of fluid physics and materials science. It was developed by the Centre National d'Etudes Spatiales (French Space Agency, CNES) and flown in collaboration with NASA.

Investigation Title: DEvice for the study of Critical LIquids and Crystallization - Directional Solidification Insert-Reflight (DSI-R)
Investigation Description: Observing clear alloys that freeze like metals in microgravity.

Investigation Title: Dynamics of Microbiomes in Space (DynaMoS)
Investigation Description: Examines how microgravity affects metabolic interactions in communities of soil microbes.

Investigation Title: eXposed Root On-Orbit Test System (XROOTS) Tech Demo
Investigation Description: Uses hydroponic and aeroponic techniques to grow plants without soil or other growth media.

Investigation Title: Fabrication of Amorphous Metals in Space (FAMIS)
Investigation Description: Studying the microstructure of composites of bulk metallic glass (BMG) and tungsten spheres processed in microgravity.

Investigation Title: Flow Boiling and Condensation Experiment (FBCE)
Investigation Description: An integrated two-phase flow boiling and condensation facility for the International Space Station

Investigation Title: Foam Optics and Mechanics (FOAM)
Investigation Description: Studies the relative stability of foams and bubbly liquids in order to gain insight into how they evolve with time.

Investigation Title: FSL Soft Matter Dynamics -- Particle STAbilised Emulsions and Foams (PASTA)
Investigation Description: Aims to study the dynamics of droplets and their size evolution in emulsions. It is sponsored by the European Space Agency (ESA) with a BPS Co-Investigator.

Investigation Title: GEARS (Genomic Enumeration of Antibiotic Resistance in Space)
Investigation Description: This investigation will focus on two types of antibiotic-resistant bacteria, Enterococcus faecalis (EF) and Enterococcus faecium, that have been found on the International Space Station and can be hazardous to crew health.

Investigation Title: Gravitation Effects on Distortion in Sintering (GEDS)
Investigation Description: Exploring liquid-phase sintering as a means to perform in-space fabrication and repair.

Investigation Title: Growth of Ternary Compound Semiconductors (MSL SCA-GTCS)
Investigation Description: Comparing the structural quality of crystals grown on Earth and in microgravity.

Investigation Title: Role of Mesenchymal Stem Cells in Microgravity Induced Bone Loss (MABL-A)
Investigation Description: Assesses the effects of microgravity on bone marrow mesenchymal stem cells (MSCs), specifically their capacity to secrete bone forming and bone dissolving cytokines (small secreted proteins that affect other cells).

Investigation Title: MeF1 (Megakaryocytes Orbiting in Outer Space and Near Earth)
Investigation Description: This investigation will study how microgravity affects platelets and bone-marrow megakaryocytes during their development and operation.

Investigation Title: Micro-14A
Investigation Description: Studying the effects of spaceflight on *Candida albicans (C. albicans)*, a pathogenic yeast that can infect the human body.

Investigation Title: Micro-16
Investigation Description: Determining loss of muscle mass and strength in space on humans by investigating the effects of space on tiny worms

Investigation Title: Microbial Tracking-3 (MT-3)
Investigation Description: Cataloging and characterizing potential disease-causing microorganisms aboard the International Space Station (ISS).

Investigation Title: Microgravity Associated Bone Loss-B (MABL-B)
Investigation Description: This investigation tests potential treatments to prevent bone loss in astronauts by examining how microgravity affects bone-forming and bone-degrading cells. Focusing on blocking IL-6 protein signaling pathways that may contribute to bone deterioration in space.

Investigation Title: Microgravity Investigation of Thermophysical Properties of Supercooled Molten Metal Oxides (ELF 5/Superglass)
Investigation Description: Measures the density, thermal expansion coefficient, viscosity and surface tension of supercooled liquids over a wide range of temperatures and compositions.

Investigation Title: MISSE-SEED
Investigation Description: Investigating the effects of long-duration space radiation exposure on seed quality and storage

Investigation Title: Multi-use Variable-g Platform Cell-02 (MVP Cell-02)
Investigation Description: This investigation's goal is to understand the effects of the space environment on evolutionary processes in the bacterium *Bacillus subtilis*.

Investigation Title: PH-07 (Plant Habitat-07)
Investigation Description: This investigation will research ++'++ Outredgeous ++'++ romaine lettuce grown in microgravity and study its response to various amounts of water.

Investigation Title: Pick-and-eat Salad-crop Productivity, Nutritional Value, and Acceptability to Supplement the ISS Food System (Veg-05)
Investigation Description: Expands crop variety to dwarf tomatoes and focuses on the impact of light quality and fertilizer on fruit production, microbial food safety, nutritional value, taste acceptability by the crew and the overall behavioral health benefits of having plants and fresh food in space.

Investigation Title: Plant RNA Regulation Redux in Multi Variable Platform (MVP) - (MVP-Plant-01)
Investigation Description: Profiles and monitors shoot and root development in plants in microgravity.

Investigation Title: Plant Water Management-5 and 6 (PWM-5 and 6)
Investigation Description: Profiles and monitors shoot and root development in plants in microgravity.

Investigation Title: Quantifying Selection for Pathogenicity and Antibiotic Resistance in Bacteria and Fungi on the ISS -- a Microbial Tracking Study - (MT-3C)
Investigation Description: Continues the third point in a time series focused on ongoing monitoring of pathogenicity (ability to cause disease).

Investigation Title: Real-Time Protein Crystal Growth-2 (RTPCG-2)
Investigation Description: Investigating protein crystal growth in microgravity to identify possible targets for drugs to treat disease

Investigation Title: Residence Time Driven Flame Spread (SoFIE-RTDFS)
Investigation Description: Studies steady and unsteady flame propagation over solid fuels in a microgravity environment.

Investigation Title: Ring Sheared Drop (RSD)
Investigation Description: Examining the formation and flow of amyloid in microgravity to better understand neurodegenerative diseases

Investigation Title: Rodent Research-10 (RR-10)
Investigation Description: Investigating how microgravity affects the cellular and molecular mechanisms of normal bone tissue regeneration in space.

Investigation Title: Rodent Research-20 (RR-20)
Investigation Description: This investigation aims to improve understanding the impact of spaceflight on women's reproductive health.

Investigation Title: SEAQUE (Space Entanglement and Annealing QUantum Experiment)
Investigation Description: aims to successfully allow quantum-level communication in space with the use of entanglement.

Investigation Title: Solid Fuel Ignition and Extinction (SoFIE) Facility
Investigation Description: Studies ignition and flammability of solid spacecraft materials in practical geometries and realistic atmospheric conditions.

Investigation Title: Solid Fuel Ignition and Extinction -- Growth and Extinction Limit (SoFIE-GEL)
Investigation Description: Studies burning in microgravity, measuring the amount of heating in a fuel sample to determine how fuel temperature affects material flammability.

Investigation Title: SoFIE-MIST (Solid Fuel Ignition and Extinction -- Material Ignition and Suppression Test)
Investigation Description: will focus on determining ways to gain control of and suppress fires on the International Space Station.

Investigation Title: Understanding of Microgravity on Animal-Microbe Interactions (UMAMI)
Investigation Description: Examining the effects of spaceflight on the molecular and chemical interactions between beneficial microbes and their animal hosts.

Investigation Title: Light Microscopy Module (LMM)
Investigation Description: A modified commercial, highly flexible, state-of-the-art light imaging microscope facility that provided researchers with powerful diagnostic hardware and software onboard the International Space Station (ISS).

Investigation Title: Advanced Colloids Experiment-Temperature control-1 (ACE-T-1)
Investigation Description: Studies tiny, suspended particles which have been designed to connect themselves in a specific way to form organized structures within water.

Investigation Title: Advanced Colloids Experiment -- Temperature-2 (ACE-T-2)
Investigation Description: Looks at the assembly of complex structures from micron-scale colloidal particles interacting via tunable attractive interactions.

Investigation Title: Advanced Colloids Experiment -- Temperature-4 (ACE-T-4)
Investigation Description: Examines the transition of an ordered crystal to a disordered glass to determine how increasing disorder affects structural and dynamic properties.

Investigation Title: Advanced Colloids Experiment -- Temperature-5 (ACE-T-5)
Investigation Description: Examines the physical and chemical characteristics of a new class of soft materials, bicontinuous interfacially jammed emulsion gels, or bijels.

Investigation Title: Advanced Colloids Experiment -- Temperature-7 (ACE-T-7)
Investigation Description: Involves the design and assembly of complex three-dimensional structures from small particles suspended within a fluid medium.

Investigation Title: Advanced Imaging, Folding, and Assembly of Colloidal Molecules (ACE-T-9)
Investigation Description: Investigating the imaging, folding, and assembly of complex colloidal molecules within a fluid medium.

Investigation Title: Advanced Colloids Experiment-Temperature-10 (ACE-T-10)
Investigation Description: Investigates the growth kinetics, microscopic dynamics, and restructuring processes in ordered and disordered structures such as colloidal crystals, glasses and gels.

Investigation Title: Advanced Colloids Experiment-Temperature Control and Gradient Sample-11 (ACE-T-11)
Investigation Description: Involves the design and assembly of complex three-dimensional (3D) structures from colloids, or small particles suspended within a fluid medium, and control of particle density and phase behavior.

Investigation Title: Advanced Colloids Experiment-Nanoparticle Haloing (ACE-T-12)
Investigation Description: Involves design and assembly of complex three-dimensional (3D) structures from colloids, or particles of different sizes suspended in a fluid.

Investigation Title: Advanced Colloids Experiment-Heated-1 (ACE-H-1)
Investigation Description: Examines densely packed microscopic spheres, or colloidal mixtures, to study their transition from ordered crystals into disordered glass.

Investigation Title: Advanced Colloids Experiment-Heated-2 (ACE-H-2)
Investigation Description: Studies a technique called nanoparticle haloing, which stabilizes colloidal mixtures and may be important for designing advanced materials for use in medicine, imaging and other fields.

Investigation Title: Advanced Colloids Experiment-Microscopy-1 (ACE-M-1)
Investigation Description: Studies the behavior of microscopic particles in gels and creams.

Investigation Title: Advanced Colloids Experiment-Microscopy-2 (ACE-M-2)
Investigation Description: Observes the microscopic behavior of liquids and gases separating from each other.

Investigation Title: Advanced Colloids Experiment-Microscopy-3 (ACE-M-3)
Investigation Description: Involves the design and assembly of complex three-dimensional structures from small particles suspended within a fluid medium.

Investigation Title: Preliminary Advanced Colloids Experiment -- Light Microscopy Module: Biological Samples (PACE-LMM-Bio)
Investigation Description: Expands the utility of the Light Microscopy Microscope hardware and provides a resource for biological studies on the International Space Station (ISS).

Investigation Title: Preliminary Advanced Colloids Experiment: 100X Oil Test Target (PACE)
Investigation Description: A technology demonstration for the Advanced Colloids Experiment (ACE) planned for future International Space Station (ISS) Expeditions.

Investigation Title: The Effect of Macromolecular Transport of Microgravity Protein Crystallization (LMM Biophysics 4)
Investigation Description: Examines the movement of single protein molecules in microgravity in order to understand why proteins crystallized in microgravity are often higher in quality than those grown on Earth.

Investigation Title: Solution Convection and the Nucleation Precursors in Protein Crystallization (LMM Biophysics-5)
Investigation Description: Tests whether solution convection -- movement of molecules through the fluid -- enhances or suppresses formation of the dense liquid clusters from which crystals form.

Investigation Title: Growth Rate Dispersion as a Predictive Indicator for Biological Crystal Samples Where Quality Can be Improved with Microgravity Growth (LMM Biophysics 6)
Investigation Description: Studies ground-based predictions of which crystals benefit from crystallization in microgravity, where Earth's gravity does not interfere with their formation.

Investigation Title: Preliminary Advanced Colloids Experiment - 2: 3D Particle Test (PACE-2)
Investigation Description: Characterizes the resolution of the high magnification colloid experiments with the Light Microscopy Module (LMM) to determine the minimum size of the particles that can be resolved by the advanced Colloids Experiment (ACE).

Investigation Title: Constrained Vapor Bubble (CVB)
Investigation Description: Aims to achieve a better understanding of the physic of evaporation and condensation and how they affect cooling processes in microgravity using a remotely controlled microscope and a small cooling device.

Investigation Title: Constrained Vapor Bubble-2 (CVB-2)
Investigation Description: Uses a miniature heat pipe and a mixture of two fuels to investigate the physics and engineering of heat transfer systems.

Investigation Title: LMM Biophysics-2 (LMMBIO-2)
Investigation Description: Characterizes the behavior of dense liquid clusters at different rates of convection, utilizing differential dynamic microscopy.

Investigation Title: Spaceflight-Induced Hypoxic-ROS Signaling (APEX-05)
Investigation Description: Growing different wild and mutant varieties of Arabidopsis thaliana in order to understand how their genetic and molecular stress response systems work in space.

Investigation Title: Transgenic Arabidopsis Gene Expression System - Intracellular Signaling Architecture (APEX-03-2 TAGES-Isa)
Investigation Description: Studies thale cress (Arabidopsis thaliana) seedlings grown in microgravity, examining the molecular changes that affect their growth.

Investigation Title: Zero Boil-Off Tank Noncondensables (ZBOT-NC)
Investigation Description: investigates how noncondensable gases interfere with fuel storage systems in microgravity.

Investigation Title: Effect of Long Duration Space Exposure on Seeds
Investigation Description: Investigating the effects of long duration exposure to microgravity and space radiation on seed viability. This is a collaboration between the United States Space Force and BPS.

Investigation Title: Alternative Splicing and Transcriptome Modulation Under Space Flight Response in Plants
Investigation Description: The purpose of this work is to extend the current functionality of the NASA GeneLab data by adding alternative splicing, novel transcribed regions and genes, and any functional significance, thus providing researchers insights into the modulated transcriptome's structural and functional consequences in response to space flight. The project workflows will help improve the reference genome annotation of Arabidopsis and set up a platform for analyzing current and future data from non-plant eukaryotes like humans, mice, yeast, and other models.

Investigation Title: Assessing Long-Term Effects of Radiation Exposure in Engineered Heart & Vascular Tissues
Investigation Description: Understanding how and why radiation exposure causes disease by using heart and blood vessel-like tissues created with stem cell biology and tissue engineering technology.

Investigation Title: Bioengineer Long-lasting 3D Neurovascular Microphysiological System to Model Chronic Inflammation Mediated Neurodegeneration
Investigation Description: Developing a long-lasting neurovascular model that can be used to evaluate the impact of chronic stressors to the brain.

Investigation Title: Circadian Rhythm Disruption and Gravitational Disturbance in a Lunar Mission Analog: Consequences for Muscle Function During and After the Mission
Investigation Description: Since Artemis astronauts will experience alterations in muscle condition and circadian rhythm simultaneously, it is critical to develop ground-based studies that will closely mimic this situation. While these stressors will occur temporarily, their effects may linger, and negatively influence muscle recovery after return from the mission. This study examines the combined effects of light cycle disturbances altered gravity in a mammalian model to gain insights into long-lasting effects that will significantly impair muscle recovery during the reloading period.

Investigation Title: Determining the Impact of Space Radiation and Simulated Microgravity on Plant Root Microbial Community Composition and Function
Investigation Description: This project examines the degree to which simulated space radiation (high-energy charged particle beams produced at the NASA Space Radiation Laboratory) and simulated microgravity disrupts plant root microbial community composition resulting in impaired microbial function.

Investigation Title: Develop a Novel Single-Cell Biodosimetry for Brain Genomic Instability and Neurodegeneration to Predict Clinical Health Outcomes in Human Spaceflight Crews
Investigation Description: The goal of this study is to determine how the space-associated stressors and sex affect mammalian brain genomic stability and its impact on age-related brain structure and function, by recreating the intravehicular radiation environment expected on spaceflight vehicles/habitats, and by using a novel genetic sensor in mice that allows for the detection of DNA damage in individual neurons.

Investigation Title: EFRI ELiS: Bioweathering Dynamics and Ecophysiology of Microbially Catalyzed Soil Genesis of Martian Regolith
Investigation Description: Studies how weathering of Martian soil simulants by microorganisms can engineer soil heath and how plants grow in response to soil improvement by microorganisms.

Investigation Title: Extended Culture of Kidney MPS and Organoids to Model Acute and Chronic Exposure to Drugs and Environmental Toxins
Investigation Description: Using kidney chips and organoids to better understand injury and recovery from chronic exposure to drugs, toxins and pathogens.

Investigation Title: Hypobaric Plant Biology in Space Exploration - Molecular Responses of Arabidopsis to Combined Effects of Low Atmospheric Pressures and Microgravity of Spaceflight Vehicles
Investigation Description: The objective of this project is to develop a refined understanding of the metabolic processes involved in plant responses and physiological adaptations to low pressure environments within space exploration vehicles and habitats. The essential drivers of this project are that hypobaric environments will likely be a feature of future exploration vehicles and habitats, together with the knowledge that plants mount complex and costly metabolic responses to hypobaria. This investigations works towards determining whether the combination of hypobaria and microgravity will have a synergistic effect on the physiological adaptation to this complex environment, and that the patterns of gene expression will reveal strategies to both understand and help ameliorate the combined effect.

Investigation Title: Identification of Biomarkers and Pathological Mechanisms via Longitudinal Analysis of Neurological and Cerebrovascular Responses to Neurotoxic Stress Using a Multi-cellular Integrated Model of the Human Brain
Investigation Description: Determining how genetically divers human brain tissue responds to neurotoxic stresses that may be encountered in space.

Investigation Title: Integrated Physiological Responses of CNS and Muscle in Drosophila and C. elegans Along a Gravity Continuum
Investigation Description: Spaceflight induces alterations in somatic/cardiac muscle, as well as in the brain. Many of these changes mirror those induced by long-term bed-rest on Earth and with age. This study used the fruit fly *Drosophila* and the worm *Caenorhabditis elegans (C. elegans)* model systems to identify conserved mechanisms underlying the oxidative stress response to altered gravity. This study includes the use of functional, structural, and molecular biological techniques to identify common genetic and molecular components that mediate the effect of microgravity, lunar gravity, and Mars gravity on organ function.

Investigation Title: Long-lived Single- and Multi-organ Tissue Equivalent (OTE) Platforms to Model the Response of Human Tissues to Various Stressors
Investigation Description: Using human organ tissue equivalents (OTEs) to gain insight into how different human tissues respond to spaceflight stressors.

Investigation Title: Long-term Patient iPC Vessel Chip Model to Assess Stressors of Atherosclerosis and mRNA Therapeutics
Investigation Description: Studying vascular signaling mechanisms to identify therapeutics for aging and radiation-related vascular diseases.

Investigation Title: Modeling Anthracycline-triggered Vascular Dysfunction
Investigation Description: Using an organ-on-chip platform to investigate how doxorubicin triggers vascular cell dysfunction which will support development of new therapeutic interventions to curtail off-target effects.

Investigation Title: Multi-Organ Repair Post Hypoxia (MORPH)
Investigation Description: Studying the effects of acute hypoxia on organ systems that are most critically affected: brain, heart, bone marrow and vasculature.

Investigation Title: Plant Trek: Investigating Strategies for Regolith Pre-Conditioning to Support the Establishment of Plant-Microbe Systems in Martian Habitats
Investigation Description: The goal of this pilot study is to develop and assess an integrated system approach for pre-conditioning and structuring Martian regolith into agriculturally stable and usable soil to support plant growth, sustain microbe-plant interactions, minimize plant stress, and optimize food production and life support. As a part of this study, a microbial consortium derived from a natural perchlorate-reducing system as a pre-inoculant will be tested for its ability to mitigate perchlorate toxins in Martian regolith simulant.

Investigation Title: Spatiotemporal Mapping of the Impact of Spaceflight on the Heart and Brain
Investigation Description: For this project the new technologies of spatial transcriptomics, single-nucleus RNA-sequencing, multi-omic spatial mapping (human and microbial) will be applied to discover new insights relevant to the impact of spaceflight on human health. These data and methods will shed light on the complex biosystem dynamics that spaceflight causes in humans, and will enable investigators to clearly dissect the gene expression changes occurring at the single-cell level, analyze how these changes affect the cell-cell genetic and physical interactions, and begin the first-ever in vivo human-microbial interaction maps from spaceflight.

Investigation Title: The Use of Microgravity Simulators for a Mechanistic Understanding of Cytoskeletal-Mediated Regulation of Root Growth
Investigation Description: Project examines the role actin cytoskeleton plays in dictating root growth directionality in microgravity and simulated microgravity by regulating the process of autotropic organ straightening.

Investigation Title: Understanding the Brain-Liver-Gut Axis during Spaceflight and Aging
Investigation Description: Providing long-term, multicellular complex human tissue models for studying responses to acute and chronic spaceflight stressors that mimic deep space exploration.

Investigation Title: Upstream Regulation of Nox2 and Skeletal Muscle Atrophy During Microgravity and Countermeasure Development
Investigation Description: Mechanotransduction is the ability to sense and regulate adaptive responses to increased or decreased loading. The investigators working on this project have found that reactive oxygen species (ROS) directly contribute to both muscle fiber atrophy and fiber-type shift from slow to fast, and through their research, have identified mitochondria, the Nox2 isoform of NADPH oxidase, and upstream angiotensin II receptor 1 (AT1R) as sources of ROS during mechanical unloading. The current focus of this work is to gain a better mechanistic understanding how Nox2 is regulated in mammalian systems in the presence of microgravity analogs.
